sentences: He is running to catch the bus.
Yesterday, she ran to the park.

prompts.stem: Build a matrix for this base. Select words you can justify as members of the word family, then prove one with a word sum and a join note.

questions.text: In the sentences, what does <running> mean?
What base carries the core meaning across this word family?
Use the matrix to generate related words. Select at least four as evidence.
Choose one selected word and write a word sum that resembles it. Include a join note supported by letter evidence.

supports.content: The base in this word family is <____> because it carries the core meaning across related words.
One word I built is <____> = <base> + <affix>. The affix adds the meaning ________.
At the join, the spelling ________ because ________.

rubric.criterion: Selects multiple related words as evidence
Produces a word sum proof that resembles the chosen word
Includes a join note supported by letter evidence

metadata.notes_for_teacher: This matrix is designed to surface consonant doubling before <-ing> (run→running). Note: ‘ran’ is a related word but not base+suffix; treat it as a family member with a different historical form.
